meanings.definition: A person who seeks favor by flattering someone in authority.
meanings.sent1: The bootlickers always complimented the boss to get what they wanted.
meanings.sent2: The bootlickers in the office constantly praised the manager to gain promotions.
meanings.sent3: The bootlickers at the meeting showered the supervisor with compliments.
meanings.sent4: The bootlickers were like bees buzzing around the queen bee, seeking approval.
meanings.sent5: The bootlickers ingratiated themselves with the principal by praising her every decision.

meanings.definition: To seek favor by flattering someone in authority.
meanings.sent1: She would bootlickers her way into the professor's good graces by praising his lectures.
meanings.sent2: He bootlickers whenever the opportunity arose to gain favor with his superiors.
meanings.sent3: The employee bootlickers shamelessly to get a raise from the manager.
meanings.sent4: The politician bootlickers his supporters to maintain their loyalty.
meanings.sent5: The student bootlickers the teacher by always volunteering to help with tasks.
